SE.description: General knowledge of access control systems and the ability to identify the protocols being used by the vehicle is required for this type of attack

WoO.description: The access control systems of a vehicle are generally static, with only exploits being removed when found via patches. But the core framework generally remains the same

SubThreats.Description: An exploitation or improper use of a system that manages access privileges within the vehicles software or hardware

SubThreats.ThreatName: Exploit Co-Located Computing Device for Privilege Escalation

ET.description: Given exploits for pre-existing devices may already be known, the attacker will only need to research how to use the device to gain access to their intended effect

SE.description: Knowledge of various types of devices that could be connected to a vehicle and how to exploit them is required for this attack to work

KoIC.description: Knowledge about specific information exchange protocols within the vehicle may benefit the attacker, but are generally not required for this attack

WoO.description: Generally these devices will always be connected to the vehicle when they are in operation; leaving a large window of time to be able to exploit them

Eq.description: Typically, only a standard computer is required to perform this attack

ET.description: A good amount of time is needed for the attacker to research the operating system and find potential exploits that they would benefit from

SE.description: High-level knowledge of operating systems and potential ways to exploit them are required for this attack

KoIC.description: This rating will change depending on the operating system that is used by the vehicle. If it is proprietary the attacker will need sensitive information in order to find exploits, but more public facing operating systems will require less insider information from the attacker

WoO.description: This rating depends on how often and well maintained the operating system is, but it is a surface that is always available for attack

Eq.description: Typically a standard computer is the only requirement, however some more specialized equipment might be required for finding exploits within the operating system

SubThreats.Description: An attack that exploits vulnerabilities found within the operating system of the vehicle

ET.description: The attacker will need to spend some time researching the TEE of the vehicle to find potential exploits and ways to benefit from them

SE.description: General knowledge of trusted execution environments and their information flows is required for this attack

KoIC.description: The attacker would need some restricted information in order to achieve this attack, but this information could be found through trial and error/researching

WoO.description: The TEE is generally static, but depending on where the exploit exists the window of opportunity can shift

Eq.description: Specialized equipment will be required for performing this attack

SubThreats.Description: An attack that exploits weaknesses within the trusted execution environment of a vehicle. This would allow the attacker to gain unauthorized access, manipulate sensitive data, or compromise vehicle systems

ET.description: The attacker will need time to research the components used within the vehicle to find these exploits

SE.description: Deep knowledge of vehicle components and how to exploit them is required for this attack to function

KoIC.description: Internal knowledge of the vehicles architecture is required for this attack to function

WoO.description: The components will always be available as a surface

Eq.description: specialized equipment is required for this attack to function

SubThreats.Description: An attack that manipulates faults within hardware components of a vehicles electronic systems PUM 4: HITRUST Threat Catalogue (2022) HITRUST Alliance. Available at: https://hitrustalliance.net/hitrust-threat-catalogue/ (Accessed: 30 October 2023).

ET.description: Some time would be required for the attacker to understand the software/firmware of the vehicle, which is subject to change with updates

SE.description: Knowledge of ways to perform arbitrary code execution, and automotive systems is required for this type of attack to work

KoIC.description: Some knowledge of the operating system and firmware is required for this type of attack to work

WoO.description: While the surface for this attaack is always available, updates would make the window of opportunity smaller

Eq.description: While developing the code for the attack only requires a standard computer, delivering the payload to the vehicle will require more specialized equipment

SubThreats.Description: An attacker injects or executes unauthorized code into a running process of the vehicle

SubThreats.ThreatName: Reprogram Co-Located Computing Device for Privilege Escalation

ET.description: Depending on the device, the co-located computing device will require less research than others to find an exploit that benefits the attacker

SE.description: The attacker will need to know how to exploit co-located computing devices

KoIC.description: Some information regarding the vehicles internal protocols is required for the attacker to benefit from their work, the initial exploits will require less proprietary knowledge

WoO.description: Depdning on the device, the attack surface for the co-located device will be available quite often

Eq.description: Typically, only a standard computer is required for this type of attack to work

SubThreats.Description: An attacker modifies a co-located computing device within the vehicle to gain elevated privileges and unauthorized control over critical functions
